before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"fghfs","text":"Be sure to read the protocol fully, before starting any manipulation. Be sure that all the equipment needed is working properly and you have enough time to do all the manipulations. If it is your first time doing this, be sure to plan more time, as usually first times take longer. Be sure that both you and environment is well protected and your laboratory regulations allow for manipulation with bacteria.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3blar","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dhn9","text":"For a single test, that consist of a triplicate you will need around 4 mL of MHB, however, it is recommended to have much more prepared (preferably around 20 mL) in case any mishaps occur. You have to have an inoculated medium on a Petri dish with discrete colonies already prepared.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"93dmp","text":"The presented protocol outlines a comprehensive assessment of the minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) and minimum bactericidal concentration (MBC) values for bacterial cell cultures. These experiments are vital for screening bacterial susceptibility to antibiotics and substances with potential antibacterial properties. The protocol not only covers the necessary preparatory steps but also introduces the application of the widely recognized Gompertz model. The protocol ensures a smooth execution of the assessment through thorough preparation and step-by-step instructions. The user-friendly instructions provided enable researchers to easily follow the protocol, facilitating the implementation of the assessment. By adhering to the outlined procedures, researchers can acquire a deeper understanding of bacterial susceptibility, evaluate the efficacy of antimicrobial agents through MIC and MBC values, and contribute to the advancement of antibacterial strategies.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"101b9","text":"The protocol provided herein is intended for informational purposes only. The authors of this protocol have made reasonable efforts to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the information presented. However, the authors do not assume any responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or damages that may occur as a result of following the protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9a778","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3tm9q","text":"Experimentation and scientific procedures involve inherent risks, and it is essential to exercise caution, adhere to safety guidelines, and consult with qualified professionals when necessary. The authors cannot be held liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, or special damages arising out of the use of this protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8eebj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ul58","text":"By utilizing this protocol, you acknowledge and accept the risks associated with experimentation and agree that the authors shall not be held responsible for any unfavorable outcomes. It is your responsibility to assess the suitability of the protocol for your specific needs and take appropriate safety measures to ensure the well-being of yourself and others involved.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eitln","text":"Remember, safety should always be the highest priority when conducting any experiments or scientific endeavors.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"4p75f","text":"The following protocol is optimised for substances that are soluble in water. However, we recommend to prepare a small portion of the solution of the investigated substance and mix it with three potions of Mueller-Hinton Broth medium to see if any precipitation or liquid-liquid phase separation occurs. If that is the case – addition of small amount of DMSO (up to 1%) may help to solubilise the substance. If this won't help, we recommend using different technique to assess MIC and MBC values.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfbl","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72mfc","text":"The following media have been used in the protocol:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhj4u","text":"   – MHB","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d9p6s","text":"   – MHA","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cmud6","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"722bc","text":"The protocol was optimised and tested using following strains:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eb0dg","text":"S. aureus 43300 (ATCC)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bt4mc","text":"P. aeruginosa 15442 (ATCC)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cj20","text":"E. coli K-12 (ATCC)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7r5mm","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"145u9","text":"This protocol can be easily adapted to other strains of bacteria, however, make sure to use suitable media, if the investigated strain is not growing on the MHA/MHB. Bare in mind, that use of MHA/MHB is in accordance with CLSI guidelines; hence, any changes have to be indicated when publishing the results.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0iff","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1cec","text":"Gompertz model file was adapted from OriginPro forums and was originally posted by the user YimingChen.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":959712,"mol_weight":0,"name":"BD DIFCO™ Mueller Hinton Broth 500g","linfor":"","url":"https://www.bd.com/en-us/products-and-solutions/products/product-page.275730#overview","sku":"275730","cas_number":"","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"5AF1A6A00AC711EEBDCCD7CBA75AE60C","entries":null,"vendor":{"id":1503,"name":"Becton Dickinson (BD)","link":"https://www.bd.com/en-us","is_requested":false,"image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}},"1":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":959713,"mol_weight":0,"name":"BD DIFCO™ Mueller Hinton Agar 500g","linfor":"","url":"https://www.bd.com/en-us/products-and-solutions/products/product-page.225250#overview","sku":"225250","cas_number":"","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"FD927E700AC711EEBDCCD7CBA75AE60C","entries":null,"vendor":{"id":1503,"name":"Becton Dickinson (BD)","link":"https://www.bd.com/en-us","is_requested":false,"image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}}}}

status.info: We are currently using this protocol, and it's working. However, the protocol might be updated in the future if any steps need to be streamlined.

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bc8vu","text":"Take the inoculated Petri dish and transfer one colony to a tube with approx.  of fresh MHB.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":88,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":77,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"3","error":false,"guid":"E8080CD00AC911EEBDCCD7CBA75AE60C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9hpl0","text":"Incubate the tube for around   (or more, depending on the strain and the size and age of the colony used) at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":29,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":109,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e3a","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"doq3k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fnrka","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":10800,"guid":"06C840D00ACB11EEBDCCD7CBA75AE60C","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"21ADEF300ACB11EEBDCCD7CBA75AE60C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"},{"length":3,"offset":203,"style":"bold"},{"length":3,"offset":282,"style":"sub"}],"key":"72pgu","text":"Stock colony can be prepared in the morning and be worked with in the early afternoon. It can also grow overnight (to the late stationary phase) and be diluted (at least by 1:50 or 1:100) with the fresh MHB. In case of the second scenario, it will take 2-3 h to reach the optimum OD600 (around 0.1). If you have any concerns refer to CLSI M100 guidelines.","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9g3l1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cpck0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4q905","text":"Prepare standardized inoculum by first measuring the OD600 of your stock colony. If the value of the OD600:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":21},{"style":"bold","offset":67,"length":14},{"style":"sub","offset":55,"length":3},{"style":"sub","offset":103,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2vedn","text":"Is greater than 0.1, dilute the culture with MHB to reach a value of 0.1,","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":45,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"esbsb","text":"Is between 0.09 and 0.1 you can move to a next step,","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vpo0","text":"is below 0.09 put the culture back and incubate it for 15-30 minutes more.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"55hbg","text":"This part should be done only when the 96-well microplate is ready to be inoculated.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
